entry.content:
You feeling it? ğŸ˜…

Oh yeah â€” we've officially entered Happy Hallow-Thanks-Mas Eve, a.k.a. Silly Season! ğŸ‘»ğŸ¦ƒğŸ„ğŸ‰

I love this time of year â€” itâ€™s special, cozy, and full of connection â€” but it also comes with its fair share of stress. If youâ€™re already feeling that pull of holiday chaos and craving something to ground you â€” Iâ€™ve got you.

The next Build with Becky Program is a 5-week â€œReigniteâ€ phase â€” designed to bring you back to basics: Squat, Hinge, Push, and Pull patterns (with a special focus on squat and horizontal push/bench press) + Core, Arms, and Glutes finishers, with guided warm-ups and mobility to keep your body feeling its best.

Youâ€™ll get 3 options for every movement, so you can lift anywhere â€” full gym, limited setup, or just bands/bodyweight if you're on the road visiting family and friends. My app walks you through everything on your phone, laptop, or tablet â€” no guesswork, no stress.

Youâ€™ll learn exactly how to lift safely and push yourself just enough to build strength without pain, plateaus, or burnout. Show up for yourself consistently, and:

  • âœ… After 1 week â†’ youâ€™ll feel better (energy, stress, sleep).
  • âœ… After 3 weeks â†’ youâ€™ll feel stronger and more capable (inside and out)
  • âœ… After 5 â†’ youâ€™ll see how strong youâ€™ve become â€” the best gift you can give yourself this season. ğŸğŸ’ª

Ready to feel grounded and ahead of the pack before the New Year rush?

ğŸš€ BWB Reignite is available starting Sunday, 11/2 â€” learn more and sign up at betterwithbecky.com.

entry.title: Who will you become by the New Year? ğŸ†

New month. New momentum.
**The holidays are coming fast â€” and so is 2026.** ğŸ˜¯
Imagine confidently walking into the gym on **January 1st**, haviâ€¦
entry.content:
New month. New momentum.

The holidays are coming fast â€” and so is 2026. ğŸ˜¯

Imagine confidently walking into the gym on January 1st, having beaten the rush, comfortable in your routine as someone who regularly prioritizes and practices fitness, building strength, and self-care! ğŸ’­

âœ¨ Start small today â€” and by the New Year, feeling strong and steady could simply be your norm. No need to go zero to 90 out the gates of a fresh new year. Simply start where you are with small, sustainable shifts (mindset counts!) and build from there.

Get a jumpstart on January - why wait for a backwards "new year, you you" narrative ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸ to make a change you already know you're ready for today. âœ…

Letâ€™s finish the year strong, grateful, and grounded. ğŸ’ª

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.title: Lift like you mean it!
entry.summary:

If youâ€™ve got a little extra glucose floating around from all the candyâ€¦ good news â€” iâ€™sâ€¦
entry.content:
Just a few of my scary lift faces from Halloween week! ğŸƒğŸ‘»

If youâ€™ve got a little extra glucose floating around from all the candyâ€¦ good news â€” iâ€™s fuel ğŸ’ª

Donâ€™t ghost on your goals now â€” put that sugar to good use (no you donâ€™t need to earn it or work it off) and keep showing up.

Hereâ€™s your little reminder to make sure youâ€™re not just going through the motions but truly PUSHING yourself in your lifts. Could you:

  • bump the weight? ğŸ¤”
  • add another rep or two? ğŸ“ˆ
  • breathe and brace with more intention and let your breath help you through another set? ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨

You are SO much stronger than you think you are. And, the only way to progress is to truly PUSH yourself.

Do it smartly, do it sustainably, but KEEP GOING and donâ€™t be afraid to test your limits, even while giving yourself grace if and when you fail â€” after all, how else will you know your true strength? ğŸ¤”

By the way, if youâ€™re ready to turn over a new leaf this fall, the New Build with Becky Reignite program drops 11/2, and the Free BWB #planksandthanks challenge starts 11/3! Stay tuned for more details on both! ğŸ‚

entry.content:
A little fall fun with my Charlie Brown last weekend!ğŸ

Justin has always seen himself in Charlie â€” and honestly, Iâ€™m probably Linus.

  • Comfort blankie / water bottle ğŸ˜‚.
  • Overthinker. ğŸ§
  • Occasional philosopher ğŸ˜…

Time Brings Runway; Runway Creates Space; Space Brings Perspective

  • Last year, this same event was one of my first times experimenting with socializing sober.
  • This year, it just feltâ€¦ normal. Easy. Ordinary in the best way. ğŸ”„

If you're in a season that feels challenging right now, hang in there â€” you might just need a little more runway.

Keep going â€” time changes things in quiet ways. It's not easy â€” yet. ğŸ’ª

entry.content:
Half the internet (and apps we use) were down yesterdayâ€”so instead of fighting it, we took the hint, hopped over to Disney's Animal Kingdom, and spent the afternoon on safariâ€¦ baby giraffe sightings (IYKYK), fudge brownie cake pops, golden hour light and all. ğŸ¦’ğŸŒ…ğŸ§ğŸ˜

Days like this one are the perfect mindful moment to pause, zoom out, be where my feet are, and notice how lucky we are to live in a place that still feels a little bit like magic. âœ¨

entry.title: World (Peri)Menopause Day: Empower Yourself with Education
entry.summary: Most women will spend **up to a third of their lives** in perimenopause and beyondâ€”yet most of us were never taught what that even means, or what to â€¦
entry.content:
Most women will spend up to a third of their lives in perimenopause and beyondâ€”yet most of us were never taught what that even means, or what to expect and how to prepare!

Letâ€™s change that. ğŸ’ª

In honor of World Menopause Day, hereâ€™s what every active woman deserves to know about this transitionâ€”and how to train, fuel, and trust yourself through it.

Perimenopause isnâ€™t â€œthe beginning of the end.â€ Itâ€™s your body evolvingâ€”hormonally, metabolically, emotionally. And with the right support, you can stay strong, capable, and confident through it all.

  • âœ¨ Education = empowerment.
  • âœ¨ Tracking symptoms = self-advocacy.
  • âœ¨ Asking better questions = better care.

If youâ€™ve felt dismissed, confused, or like your body suddenly changed â€œfor no reasonâ€... it didnâ€™t. You're not broken. You just havenâ€™t been given the language or toolsâ€”yet.

ğŸ“© Save this post for when you need a reminder that you have everything you need to navigate the next phase of life with self-compassion, grace, and strength!

Share it with a friend who deserves better, too. ğŸ’œ

#WorldMenopauseDay #PerimenopauseAwareness #StrongNotSilent #BetterWithBecky #WomensHealth #MidlifeStrength #EducateEmpowerEvolve

entry.title: Halfway to Halloween!ğŸƒ
entry.summary:
ğŸƒ Halfway to Halloween â€” and halfway through October! ğŸ˜±
ğŸ‘»Cue Ghostbusters themeâ€”because weâ€™re busting through [fall funks and fitness fears this wâ€¦
entry.content:
ğŸƒ Halfway to Halloween â€” and halfway through October! ğŸ˜±

ğŸ‘»Cue Ghostbusters themeâ€”because weâ€™re busting through fall funks and fitness fears this week. ğŸ’ª

If youâ€™ve felt a little off lately, hereâ€™s your gentle reminder: you still have two solid weeks to build momentum before Halloween. ğŸ‚ğŸ“ˆğŸƒâ€â™€ï¸

Thatâ€™s 14 days to fit in fitness! In that time, you could

  • âœ… establish a supportive environment, or revisit a tried + true routine;
  • ğŸ”œ shift out of that â€œstuckâ€ feeling that comes from a fixed mindset;
  • ğŸª cultivate community or reach out to friends or family to nuture relationships;
  • ğŸ“Š practice a program or prioritize progress in a specific skill!

Itâ€™s actually spooky how much progress you could make â€”mind AND body â€”in that time, should you simply decide to start.

If youâ€™re feeling overwhelmed

  • ğŸ¤Start small.
  • ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨Take a few deep breaths.
    • (try this: breathe in for 3 counts, hold for 4, and exhale for 7, repeat 3x to shift your nervous system out of a sympathetic state of fight or flight into parasympathetic rest + digest recovery mode).
  • âœ”ï¸Do something over nothing.
    • ğŸ‹ï¸â€â™€ï¸A few squats. A short walk. One good lift.

It all adds upâ€”and future you will thank you. âœ…

âœ¨ Stay steady. Keep showing up. Your next win might be closer than you think. ğŸ’¥

entry.title: Train like an athlete ğŸ’ª
entry.summary: You donâ€™t need to _look_ like an athlete to train like one â€” but you do need to THINK like one. ğŸ§ Ten weeks ago, I could do three chin-ups. Recently,â€¦
entry.content:
You donâ€™t need to look like an athlete to train like one â€” but you do need to THINK like one. ğŸ§  Ten weeks ago, I could do three chin-ups. Recently, I hit 10 reps for the first time! ğŸ¥³

How did I get there?

I stopped treating chin-ups like a party trick and started treating them like a skill I was developing for a specific period of time in a purposeful way.

I gave myself a time-boxed goal: 10 weeks to 10 chin-ups, and added a 3x/week chin-up skill drill warm-up routine to my regular workouts to get stronger in this particular movement).

That shift â€” from movement maintenance to purposeful practice â€” changed everything!

  • ğŸ’ª I prioritized pulling first thing
  • ğŸ‹ï¸â€â™€ï¸ I trained with intention
  • ğŸ“ˆ I tracked my progress
  • ğŸ—“ï¸ I showed up and gave my full effort, even when it felt boring or I didnâ€™t progress
  • ğŸ˜´ I actually took rest days, knowing that recovery was actually where I was going to get stronger

Hereâ€™s the part we donâ€™t talk about enough:

You donâ€™t build strength by chasing motivation.

You discover discipline by showing up consistently for deliberate practice â€” the quiet kind that rewires how your body, breath, and brain show up under load.

This is what training like an athlete looks + feels like:

  • âœ… You pick a plan + stick to it regardless of how you feel
    • ğŸ’­(related: you learn that feelings follow action - the more you show up, the better you feelâ€¦the more you WANT to show up). ğŸ”„
  • âŒ You stop winging it + you start to track data (and let it inform your next steps)
    • ğŸ¤”(related: you get guidance where you need it, and implement feedback to improve your efforts)
  • â¤ï¸â€ğŸ©¹ You recover on purpose. and stop over-training
    • ğŸ™‡â€â™€ï¸ (related: you embrace the fact that you can do ANYTHING but you canâ€™t do EVERYTHING and you get specific about your goal and donâ€™t allow distractions)
  • ğŸ—ºï¸ You learn to love the journey over the destination - even the reps that donâ€™t feel impressive.

Turns out the goal wasnâ€™t ten chin-ups. It was to become the kind of person who can do them. ğŸ’ª

If youâ€™ve ever wondered what life might feel like with a little less alcohol â€” or just moâ€¦
entry.content:
And just sometimes, that person turns out to be you. ğŸ¥°

If youâ€™ve ever wondered what life might feel like with a little less alcohol â€” or just more presence â€” this might be your sign to get curious.

ğŸ’« Sober curiosity has felt a lot like coming home to myself...

This year has been one long re- â€”

  • reconnecting with the part of me that knew joy naturally before I tried to edit it
  • rediscovering ease in my own skin (and mind and heart, for that matter)
  • redefining and reprioritizing what (and who) truly matters
  • reminding myself that comfort can come from so many places

ğŸ¥‚Cheers to that!âœ¨

If you were to get curious about one thing that might bring you closer to yourself â€” what would it be? ğŸ§

Sober-Curious?

ğŸ’­ Want to peek behind the curtain? Hereâ€™s more from the journey:

  • ğŸ‘‰ Cheers to 1 Month of Sober Curiosity
  • ğŸ‘‰ 2 Month Sober Curious Update from Japan: from FOMO to JOMO

entry.title: ğŸ§ World Mental Health Day: Don't let the Holidays Haunt you! ğŸšï¸ğŸ‘»
entry.summary: **[World Mental Health Day](https://www.who.int/campaigns/world-mental-health-day)** (Oct 10) is a global reminder that **well-being starts from the â€¦
entry.content:
World Mental Health Day (Oct 10) is a global reminder that well-being starts from the inside out â€” and that includes how we move through the holidays. ğŸ‚â˜•ï¸ğŸğŸŒ²â„ï¸

This year, instead of letting seasonal stress sneak up on you, try this quick 5-minute reflection:

  • 1ï¸âƒ£ What drained me most last holiday season?
  • 2ï¸âƒ£ What gave me real peace or energy?
  • 3ï¸âƒ£ What can I start to do even now to prepare, protect my peace and energy, and make stressful moments easier to navigate?

Itâ€™s not about perfection â€” itâ€™s about presence.

This season, tune in to your mind, body, habits, and relationships. Hereâ€™s how to stay ahead instead of behind:

  • âœ”ï¸ Identify: If you know what drains you every year â€” thatâ€™s your map. Plan around it, donâ€™t white-knuckle through.
  • âœ”ï¸ Anchor: Set (at least) one mental health â€œminimumâ€ now â€” comforting routines and rituals go a long way during a season full of twists and turns - five minutes of quiet, one non-negotiable boundary youâ€™ll protect, one movement routine (like a daily walk) that keeps you feeling steady and grounded.
  • âœ”ï¸ Reframe: Mental health isnâ€™t about never feeling stress. Itâ€™s about catching it early and recovering faster with more resilience. Communicating your needs early so you can stay calm and proactive, not rushed and reactive.

âœ¨ Mindful Moment: Ask yourself, â€œWhat does it look like to feel physically, mentally, and emotionally well this holiday season?â€ Then make choices that support that version of you.

  • ğŸ—“ Use World Mental Health Day as a reset button â€” not just for awareness, but action.
  • ğŸ‘‰ Save this post as your calm-season checklist to revisit when things get hectic.
  • ğŸ’­ And think of Future You â€” when you wake up on Jan 1, how do you want to feel? Work backward from that version of yourself. Youâ€™ve got this. ğŸ¥°

entry.title: ğŸƒ Goblin Squat Challenge Returns! ğŸ‘»
entry.summary:
ğŸƒ Goblin Squat Challenge Returns! ğŸ‘»
Ready to kick off your _Fit Fall Spooky Season_?
Join the **Free Better with Becky Goblin Squat Challenge**â€¦
entry.content:
ğŸƒ Goblin Squat Challenge Returns! ğŸ‘»

Ready to kick off your Fit Fall Spooky Season?

Join the Free Better with Becky Goblin Squat Challenge and get stronger with a super-simple daily or weekly squat routine â€” no matter your schedule.

ğŸ•¸ Pick your poison â˜ ï¸: boost strength, build endurance, or both! Weâ€™re playing with the number 31 â€” just for fun.

Option 1: Build Strength (1x/week)

  • Work up to your 1-rep max in a squat or leg press pattern. Complete 3 attempts after warming up. Go heavy, rest plenty.

Option 2: Build Endurance (Daily or Every Other Day)

  • Do 31 reps of squats â€” assisted, bodyweight, or weighted. Break them up through the day (10 AM / 10 PM / 11 PM) for a metabolism-friendly after-eating digestion boost.

Option 3: Both!

  • Combine both approaches in your regular lifts (1â€“3x/week). Example: 3 sets of 10 squats (or 3 sets of 5 split squats on each leg) + 1 extra rep (maybe an isometric hold for a challenge!). Limit to 3x/week to recover well.

Option 4: Alternatives

  • See tracker for seasonal swaps and creative twists!

âœ… Option to track your progress and watch your strength stack up with the free challenge tracker â€” message â€œGoblin Squatsâ€ to get yours and check off each day as you go!

I'll personally be starting on Monday October 6 and enjoying Squatober right up through Halloween on the 31st for 4 weeks of squat pattern practice - feel free to join me, or start when you can, mixing and matching options as schedule, interest, and recovery needs allow.

  • ğŸ‘» No ghosting our gains this month.
  • ğŸ“ˆ Always remember: something is better than nothing!
  • ğŸ’ª Letâ€™s get spooky strongâ€”together. âœ¨ğŸƒ

entry.title: Who will you become by Thanksgiving? ğŸ¦ƒ

entry.content:
Gentle reminderâ€¦

Change feels uncomfortable because it asks you to leave behind whatâ€™s familiar. It challenges the habits youâ€™ve grown used to, but nothing new is created in comfort.

The uneasiness isnâ€™t a warning, itâ€™s a sign youâ€™re stepping into growth, into strength, into a version of yourself you havenâ€™t met yet. ğŸ’ª

â€¦and maybe one day youâ€™ll look back and see change was a gift. Now read the last line again. ğŸ’

entry.title: My Results after 1 Year of Build with Becky!
entry.summary:
Ever overthinkâ€¦well, everything?! ğŸ˜… Same.
Which is why this update feels fun to shareâ€”for once, Iâ€™m not (at least not _too much_â€”baby steps!) Lettâ€¦
entry.content:
Ever overthinkâ€¦well, everything?! ğŸ˜… Same.

Which is why this update feels fun to shareâ€”for once, Iâ€™m not (at least not too muchâ€”baby steps!) Letting things feel a little lighter is a new focus! âœ¨

These photos span years (not weeks) of my journey, with a closer look at the past year using my own Build with Becky program + macro tracking.

In the past, I mightâ€™ve avoided posting something like this. As a trainer, the last thing I want is for transformation photos to invite comparison or judgment. This is my journey.

My body is neutral. Itâ€™s not better or worse when itâ€™s bigger or smaller, stronger or weakerâ€”just like Iâ€™m not a better person now that Iâ€™m taller than when I was shorter. ğŸ¤£ The baseline is: my body is a good body, always. I hope you can hold that baseline for yourself, too.

At the same time, I believe in body autonomy. Within my genetics, time, and energy, I can choose to explore whatâ€™s possible: build muscle, lose fat, engage in body recomposition. What used to come from a place of â€œnot enoughâ€ now comes from curiosity, data-not-identity, and continuous learning.

Hereâ€™s the simple-not-always-easy â€œhowâ€ behind this particular year:

  • âœ… Consistent, progressive strength training 3x/week (my BWB program ğŸ’ª)
  • âœ… Macro tracking (prioritizing protein+fiber, with seasonal tweaks to carbs/fats, with a very slow, sustainable calorie deficit)
  • âœ… Mindfulness & body-led behavior and habit change (sleep, steps, stress management, nixing alcohol, mindset)
  • âœ… Prioritizing mental + emotional health + relationships alongside physical health
  • âœ… Finding deeper purpose and meaning in my work
  • âœ… Ongoing education and support

This isnâ€™t the whole story, but itâ€™s a a few snapshots of growthâ€”inside and out.

entry.title: Food for Fuel (Fall Pre-and-Post-Workout Edition) ğŸ
entry.summary:
Did you know you should ğŸ’¯ make carbs your preferred training (and recovery) fuel, _even if you eat lower-carb?_ ğŸ¤¨
Here's why:
**Pre-workout = Fâ€¦
entry.content:
Did you know you should ğŸ’¯ make carbs your preferred training (and recovery) fuel, even if you eat lower-carb? ğŸ¤¨

Here's why:

Pre-workout = Fast Fuel

You want mostly quick-digesting carbs pre-workout, with just a little protein or fat so it sticksâ€”skip the fiber right before and after so fuel isnâ€™t slowed down. Coffee always a welcome bonus ğŸ˜‰

Post-workout = Repair + Recover

Stick with (lean) protein + carbs post-workout to help muscles rebuild + recover. This is prime-time for a sweet seasonal treatâ€”your muscles are extra ready to suck that sugar up and use it to shuttle the protein to your muscles for replenishment!

Easy, fun, seasonal ideas to try (several from Sbux or TJ's! If you're a ğŸƒ or â˜•ï¸ girly...you're welcome!)

  • Modified PSL/Americano + a protein bar
  • Chocolate PB cream of rice (w/tasty toppings)
  • Vanilla mango (or pineapple) protein shake
  • Espresso + rice cake with nut butter + a bite of dark chocolate
  • Pumpkin Greek yogurt or overnight oats with crunchy seed clusters
  • Rice-cake tostada with cottage cheese, avocado salsa, veggies
  • Simply eat your next meal: rotisserie chicken + rice + fruit, or sheet-pan dinner with tons of seasonal roasted veggies, lentils, and chicken sausage that's super easy to toss in the air fryer

PS: Wondering about whether to use Pre-Workout Supplements?

  • One review looked at 22 studies comparing popular multi-ingredient pre-workout supplements to placebo. Caffeine had the biggest effect on acute training performance.

  • Creatine also works for boosting strength (if taken daily - 5g minimum, though larger doses may have have cognitive benefits), but it isn't an acute effect. So, doesn't matter if you take it pre-workout + I've recently learned from my new bodybuilding coach (yay, @alexarukstela!) that it also should not be taken w/caffeine, so apologies for the rice cake/caffeine/creatine combo above - know better, do better!ğŸ’ª

entry.content:
Life isnâ€™t linear. ğŸ“ˆğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸ğŸ“‰

It comes with twists and turns, and we may need to reach, push, and pullâ€”sometimes just with one arm or leg at a time, stabilizing from a strong centerâ€”all at once! ğŸ¦µğŸ’ª

Thatâ€™s why the next Build with Becky program, Symmetry Synergy, blends unilateral strength with push/pull/core combination moves. While most of my programs focus on heavier compound major lifts and progressive overload, this program allows you to develop more endurance and address imbalances, asymmetries, plus build single-sided strength to feel more balanced and stable in the gym and in your life!

Think moves like those shown: band-resisted dead bugs, challenging cable bird dog rows and sync brain and body, and split-stance strength that challenges your balance and builds coordination under loadâ€”plus develops grip strength, a key biomarker for healthspan and longevity.

Weâ€™re training for resilience inside and out. And if you happen to notice some aesthetic perks along the way? Sorry not sorryâ€”thatâ€™s all you. ğŸ˜

Ready to move with more control, balance, strength, and grace? ğŸ¤”

Build with Becky: Symmetry Synergy is coming next weekend! âœ¨

Learn more, sign up and feel better, inside and out, in just 5 weeks! ğŸ—“ï¸

entry.title: Trick: Stay Consistent. Treat: Get Stronger, Inside and Out
entry.summary:
**Mid-Month Vibe Check ğŸ‘»**
- âœ¨ That shiny new-month energy? â†’ Fading fast. Days darker, colder, shorter. ğŸ¤§ - ğŸ’€ Excuses? â†’ Creeping in. Busier schâ€¦
entry.content:
Mid-Month Vibe Check ğŸ‘»

  • âœ¨ That shiny new-month energy? â†’ Fading fast. Days darker, colder, shorter. ğŸ¤§
  • ğŸ’€ Excuses? â†’ Creeping in. Busier schedules, heavier yawns, fuller calendars. ğŸ“†
  • ğŸƒ Halloween? â†’ Scarily close; just 2.5 weeks away. Where does the time go?! ğŸ˜±

If your momentum feels wobbly right now, good news: youâ€™re right on schedule. Week 3 is where the honeymoon ends and reality kicks in. It's what separates dreamers from doers:

  • ğŸ‘‰ mindful habits start to stack up, kick in, and help make things feel more effortless, and
  • ğŸ‘‰ a deeper, more intentional form of growth begins to take root and become your new normal.

Hump Day dips, skipped sessions, â€œIâ€™ll do it tomorrowâ€ thinkingâ€¦ all totally normal, and part of the journey.

But hereâ€™s the much-needed reframe to set you apart and keep you going when others give up:

Every setback (physical, mental, or emotional) is just a setup for a comeback. ğŸ™Œ

  • ğŸª„ The Trick â†’ Motivation wonâ€™t magically appear. ğŸ™ˆ
  • ğŸ¬ The Treat â†’ Show up anyway, and let consistency do its magic. ğŸ’ª

You donâ€™t have to believe every tired thought or frazzled feeling. You just have to act like the version of you that youâ€™re practicing becoming.

Feelings follow action. Consistency compounds.

And guess what? I bet you already have a small win or two worth celebrating. ğŸ‰

Even tiny wins count. (Seriously â€” name one thing youâ€™ve done in the past 2.5 weeks that Past You would high-five and celebrate the shit out of it. ğŸ™Œ)

Donâ€™t ghost your goals now. ğŸ‘» Keep showing up: scared, busy, or unmotivated, and let momentum build with each rep! ğŸ’ª

www.betterwithbecky.com

entry.title: BOTH things can be true!
entry.summary:
Have you ever watched a baby just learning to walk? ğŸ¥¹
No one expects them to stand up and sprint. ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸
They crawl, topple, wobble. And that isâ€¦
entry.content:
Have you ever watched a baby just learning to walk? ğŸ¥¹

No one expects them to stand up and sprint. ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸

They crawl, topple, wobble. And that is exactly how it's supposed to go. Sometimes they get 3 steps in a row...only to plop down on their cute lil bums and have a cry. That's okay too, and it's heartwarming to watch them continue to pull themselves back to their feet and try again.

Starting something new in fitness is no different.

You donâ€™t need to have all the answers. You donâ€™t need perfect form, the perfect plan, or expert confidence.

What you need is full permission to let yourself be a beginner. To wobble like a baby giraffe while you find your feet and learn to stand tall (IYKYK ğŸ¦’).

Every handstand, every PR, every confident lifter in the gym started with awkward first steps.

And while it's almost certainly true that you are capable of MORE than you think - it can SIMULTANEOUSLY BE TRUE that you are allowed to be a beginner, start where you are, and grow as you go!

So if youâ€™ve been waiting to feel readyâ€”this is your invitation. Take one small, shaky step today. Thatâ€™s how strength starts to build! ğŸ’ª

entry.title: Learning Lately: Recommended Reads
entry.summary:
ğŸ“š Update from my bookshelf!
Over the past few months Iâ€™ve been reading 2 books written by physicians: [Being Mortal](https://amzn.to/42gjwxs) by Aâ€¦
entry.content:
ğŸ“š Update from my bookshelf!

Over the past few months Iâ€™ve been reading 2 books written by physicians: Being Mortal by Atul Gawande and Outlive by Peter Attia.

  • âœ… Being Mortal reframed how I think about the medicalization of aging + end of life care in Americaâ€”how even well-intentioned care can sometimes work against dignity and autonomy in our later years.
  • âœ… Outlive drove home the shift from focusing only on lifespan to optimizing healthspanâ€”adding not just years to life, but life to our years.

The 1â€“2 punch of these books pushed me to rethink long-term strategies and make immediate changes in my own health behaviors & mindsetâ€”for example, shifting my cholesterol numbers to decrease my cardiovascular disease risk.

Together, they nudged me to ask myself: What do I want my future years to look likeâ€”not just in quantity, but in quality? ğŸ¤” And, what can I do now to improve my chances?

Whatâ€™s Next on My List

Now, Iâ€™m eager to explore similar questions from pioneering women:

  • ğŸ‘‰ Joyspan by Dr. Kerry Burnight
  • ğŸ‘‰ The Telomere Effect by Dr. Elizabeth Blackburn (Nobel Prize-winning scientist who discovered telomerase) and Dr. Elissa Epel (health psychologist researching how habits protect telomeresâ€”tiny DNA 'clocks' tied to aging).

I was lucky enough to hear Dr. Epel speak at Stanfordâ€™s Healthy Aging Conference earlier this year, and canâ€™t wait to dive into her work!

These books carry the conversation furtherâ€”down to DNA and cellular health, and beyond the blueprint of longevity and healthspan towards the bigger picture of joyspan: the pursuit of a long, healthy life thatâ€™s also deeply fulfilling.

Stay tuned for what are sure to be many more lessons and takeaways in the weeks + months aheadâ€”what are you reading and loving lately? ğŸ¤“

entry.title: What to Look For in a Partner (Hint: Itâ€™s Not Shared Interests)
entry.summary:
Sometimes I look back at 18-year-old Becky and think: _damn_â€¦was that girl really smart, or just super lucky? ğŸ§ğŸ˜…
I met [Justin](https://justin.seaâ€¦
entry.content:
Sometimes I look back at 18-year-old Becky and think: damnâ€¦was that girl really smart, or just super lucky? ğŸ§ğŸ˜…

I met Justin in one of those transitional, vulnerable life phases when youâ€™re desperate for an anchorâ€”someone consistent, reliable, truly partnering with you through the unknown.

22 years later, 40-year-old Becky still wakes up feeling so lucky to be in love with @searls. Who else would happily tolerate my random Downton Abbey obsession to the level of:

  • âœ¨ Saying â€œGo for it!â€ when I suggested visiting Highclere Castle in the UK
  • âœ¨ Planning a date night for the final Downton Abbey movie premiere

Hereâ€™s the thing: Justin doesnâ€™t love Downton Abbey (or, frankly, fitness or lifting weights ğŸ˜…). He loves me.

And that means heâ€™s all-in for anything that brings me joy, even if itâ€™s not his thing.

Thatâ€™s the kind of support that makes a relationship feel like an everyday epic romance. The gift of someone who cheers you on, quietly supports and even enjoys your quirks, and evolves with you as passions and interests change over the years.

ğŸ’¡ So tell me: what do you look for in your relationships? Whether with a partner, friends, family, or colleaguesâ€”

  • ğŸ‘‰ What values matter most to you?
  • ğŸ‘‰ How do you feel most supported?
  • ğŸ‘‰ And how do you ensure the people you love feel seen, heard, and understood in return?

Because at the end of the day, joyspanâ€”the long, healthy, enjoyable life we all wantâ€”isnâ€™t just about what we get from others. Itâ€™s also about what we give. â¤ï¸

entry.title: Exercise Snack and Stack your way to Better Metabolic Health
entry.summary:
Ever feel sleepy or snacky after you eat? ğŸ¥±
Thatâ€™s your blood sugar spiking...and then crashing. ğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰
Here are 4 super-simple **post-prandial exeâ€¦
entry.content:
Ever feel sleepy or snacky after you eat? ğŸ¥±

Thatâ€™s your blood sugar spiking...and then crashing. ğŸ“ˆğŸ“‰

Here are 4 super-simple post-prandial exercise snacks (a fancy way of saying moving after eating) to steady energy, reduce spikes, and support your metabolic healthâ€”how well your body uses food for fuel. ğŸ’ª

ğŸ‘‰ Who might want to pay closer attention?ğŸ§

Those who are noticing energy crashes after meals, cravings , brain fog or low sleep quality, unwanted abdominal weight gain / belly fat, or who have been told they have any of these early signs or common precursors:

  • âš ï¸ High blood sugar (prediabetes, insulin resistance)
  • âš ï¸ High blood pressure
  • âš ï¸ High triglycerides / Low HDL (â€œgoodâ€ cholesterol)
  • âš ï¸ PCOS (often tied to insulin resistance in women)

The good news: research shows even tiny â€œexercise snacksâ€ done after eating can move the needleâ€”sometimes even reversing risk factors!

Research-Backed Exercise Snacks to Try within ~90 in of Eating

  • ğŸ¦µCalf (Soleus) Raises - these tiny but mighty muscles, though only 1% of your bodyweight, if activated correctly, can do BIG things to improve metabolic health in the rest of the body
  • ğŸš¶ 10-minutes of walking - lowers blood sugar and helps your body use energy better
  • ğŸ‹ï¸ 10 (bodyweight) air squats, every ~45 min = keeps big muscles working, so that the glucose (sugar) that you eat doesnâ€™t just sit in your blood.
  • ğŸ§º Housework / Chores ~15 min of NEAT, i.e. active housework or chores like folding laundry, vacuuming is great, too!

These arenâ€™t full workouts and you won't have to change or sweat. ğŸ˜“ğŸ™…â€â™€ï¸

They're micro-moves with macro-impact.

  • ğŸ’­ Which snack will you try first?
  • ğŸ’­ How could you habit-stack and sprinkle these "snacks" around meals to reach ~30 min of metabolic-improving movement throughout your dayâ€”even without a formal â€œworkoutâ€?

entry.title: The Simple Path to More Chin-Ups (Fast)
entry.summary:
**Youâ€™re standing there, staring up at that chin-up bar.**
Right now, maybe 3 reps feels like your ceiling (or youâ€™re not even thereâ€¦_yet_).
##â€¦
entry.content:
Youâ€™re standing there, staring up at that chin-up bar.

Right now, maybe 3 reps feels like your ceiling (or youâ€™re not even thereâ€¦yet).

The Secret

ğŸ¤« Itâ€™s not about trying harder. Itâ€™s about:

  • following a simple progressive plan (ğŸ“¸ screenshot at end!)
  • giving your muscles adequate time to rest + recover (between sets and between workouts).

The Method

Think of it like climbing a ladderâ€”each effort builds on the last.

You can't leapfrog over building your base:

  • build your foundation first
  • troubleshoot weak spots and get stronger with targeted drills

Once you have a solid foundation, add just enough challenge to spark adaptation (progressive overload + minimal effective dose), then step back and let recovery do the real work.

Thatâ€™s where the magic happens. âœ¨

The Invitation

Donâ€™t just watch meâ€”youâ€™re the main character here.

Show up, follow the plan, rest, repeatâ€¦ and watch yourself unlock strength faster than you thought possible. ğŸ¤¯

Bonus: while this may seem like a physical challenge, the growth mindset you'll unlock along the way is incredibly applicable to smashing through self-limiting beliefs in all areas of your life!

ğŸ“¸ Screenshot the free plan at the end of the video and make your move. Commit, be consistent, and see what happens! ğŸ’ª

entry.title: Eat for Energy: Protein-Packed, Fiber-Forward A.M. Options!
entry.summary:
**Hit 50g protein + 10g fiber by middayâ€”without trying.**
Find it hard to get enough protein or fit fiber into your day? I used to feel the same wâ€¦
entry.content:
Hit 50g protein + 10g fiber by middayâ€”without trying.

Find it hard to get enough protein or fit fiber into your day? I used to feel the same way, until I decided to break the goal down into smaller pieces.

Instead of looking at a number like 100+ grams of protein + not knowing where to start, I thought: "I wonder if I could hit 50g of protein by midday?" ğŸ¤” and, with some practice, that became second nature!

So here are some simple ways to front-load your day w/delicious fuel so that managing your energy, appetite, +meal timing feels easy.

Mix & match these easy A.M. options:

  • â˜•ï¸ Collagen protein coffee (1 scoop): ~15â€“20g P, 3g F â†’ great add-on; pair with a complete protein later (eggs/dairy).
  • ğŸ“ Greek yogurt chocolate protein berry bowl (Â¾â€“1 cup Greek yogurt + Â½â€“1 PB-cup-style protein bar crumbled + berries + 1 Tbsp chia + almonds): ~35â€“45g P, 12â€“16g F. (bump to 50g+ protein if you stir in some chox protein powder!)
  • ğŸ¥‘ Avocado egg toast (2 eggs + 2 slices higher-protein, higher-fiber bread + Â¼â€“Â½ avocado): ~28â€“36g P, 9â€“13g F.
  • ğŸ« Cottage cheese + Greek yogurt bowl (Â¾ cup each + 1 Tbsp chia + berries): ~35â€“40g P, 10â€“13g F.
  • ğŸ§€ High-protein snack + berries (30g protein shake + string cheese + 1â€“1Â½ cups berries): ~36â€“37g P, 5â€“8g F.

Easy combos to clear 50/10 by midday:

  • ğŸ¯Avocado egg toast (â‰ˆ32/11) + collagen coffee (â‰ˆ18/0) â†’ â‰ˆ50g P / 11g F
  • ğŸ¯Yogurt protein berry bowl alone

âš ï¸ Tip: Collagen is supportive for joints/skin but not a complete proteinâ€”treat it as a bonus & anchor with a complete amino acid profile from eggs, dairy, or whey.

âš ï¸ Also note: pre-workout, you actually want less protein/fiber, because they take longer to digest! â€”instead, opt for quick-digesting carbs + a little bit of fat to keep energy stable during a lift.
